results.title: L.A. confidential [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Curtis Hanson, Michael Nathanson, Arnon Milchan and Regency Enterprises
results.brief_description: Based on a James Ellroy novel, ‘L.A. Confidential’ perfectly recreates the mythology of film noir embedded within the city of Los Angeles circa 1950. Stylishly melding real and imagined Hollywood and crime folklore, the complex plot involves hookers that are made up to look like movie stars, corrupt cops on the take, sleazy tabloid journalists and of course, murder. Russell Crowe is excellent as the brutish but honest cop who teams up with an opportunistic rookie (Guy Pearce), and a smooth, star struck police officer (Kevin Spacey), to solve the gang style murder of a group of innocent bystanders in a late night diner. The investigation uncovers a sinister web of blackmail, sex and greed, implicating some of the upper echelons of L.A. society. No noir film would be complete without the obligatory femme fatale, played with sultry poise by Kim Basinger who won an Oscar for her performance. Rather than it being mere pastiche, director Curtis Hanson treats the material in a direct, earnest fashion and in doing so delivers one of the best examples of the genre for some time. Cast also includes Danny DeVito, David Strathairn and James Cromwell.

results.title: L.A. Confidential
results.brief_description: Three detectives in the corrupt and brutal L.A. police force of the 1950s use differing methods to uncover a conspiracy behind the shotgun slayings of the patrons at an all-night diner.

constellations_other.name: Monsters, murder and mystery
constellations_other.description: Murder and mystery hide in the shadows born from German Expressionism.

results.title: L'une et L'autre = the Other One
results.brief_description:
A young actress, with a rather fragile personality, borrows her sister’s identity in order to break-up with her current lover.

Credits: Producer, Nicole Stephane ; director, Rene Allio ; writers, Rene Allio, Gerard Pollicand ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Claude Dauphin, Malka Ribowska, Francoise Prevost, Christian Alers.

results.title: L'Orfeo
results.brief_description: This opera, sung in Italian, was written by Claudio Monteverdi under the commission of the Duke of Mantua, who wanted the legend of Orfeo, revived in the previous century, set to music. Monteverdi combines dramatic tension, eloquent expression of human passions and formal variety in his setting of Alessandro Stiggio’s libretto. The direction, staging and design is by Jean-Pierre Ponnelle. Features singers Pillippe Huttenlocher (Orfeo), Dietlinde Turban (Euridice), Trudeliese Schmidt (Musica/Speranza), Roland Hermann (Apollo), Glenys Linos (Proserpina), Werner Groschel (Plutone), Hans Franzen (Caronte), Suzanne Calabro (Ninfa) and the Monteverdi Ensemble of the Zurich Opera House conducted by Nikolaus Harnoncourt. No English subtitles.

results.title: L'Orange
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Fitzroy High School by Year 9 students this short film parodies French arthouse cinema through its photography, movement and sound. Whimsical and somewhat amusing. Voiceover in French - no subtitles. Original soundtrack by Tom Noonan.

results.title: L'or du Duc = the Duke's Gold
results.brief_description:
Adhemar, Rajah of Kashmir decides to play a nasty trick on his estranged relatives and disinherit them all … except for Ludovic, a vague nephew. Ludovic is a hopeless dreamer and gambler, up to his neck in debts and unpaid tax bills who has to support a wife and ten children. The inheritance arrives in the form of a double-decker bus in which the family promptly moves in order to avoid creditors and gendarmes. For the family, the bus is a wonderful toy which allows them to visit Paris and meet with eccentric characters. The bus also attracts the interest of the Rajah’s former servant, for he alone knows that the double-decker is made of pure gold. This is a charming comedy filled with surrealistic moments and songs.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Kalfon ; director, Jacques Baratier ; writers, jacques Baratier, Eric Ollivier ; photography, Henri Raichi ; music, Michel colombier, Charles Trenet, Robert Rocca ; assistant director, Paul Vecchiali.
Cast: Pierre Brasseur, Jacques Dufilho, Claude Rich, Mony Tarbes, Christian Marin, Jacques Jouanneau, Annie Cordy, Jean Richard, Daniel Emilfork, Daniele Darrieux, Pierre Rep, Noel Roquevert.

results.title: L'ombre Rouge = the Red Shadow
results.creator_credit: Jean-Louis Comolli, Claudio Bondi and Marin Karmitz
results.brief_description:
In April 1937, Anton, a Soviet spy, is captured in Paris. Anton is involved in gun smuggling activities for the benefit of the Spanish Republican Army. He is taken to Bavaria to be exchanged against Muller, a double agent.

Credits: Producers, Marin Karmitz, Claudio Bondi ; director, Jean-Louis Comolli ; writers, Jean Louvet, Gerard Guicheteau, Claudio Bondi, Jean-Louis Comolli ; photography, William Lubtchansky ; music, Michel Portal.
Cast: Claude Brasseur, Nathalie Baye, Jacques Dutronc, Andrea Ferreol, Alexandre Arbatt, Pascal Bonitzer, Patrick Depeyrat.

results.title: L'oeil du Malin = the Third Lover
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Carlo Ponti and Georges de Beauregard
results.brief_description:
A second-rate French journalist visiting West Germany to write a series of articles meets a successful author and his French wife, who appear to be an exceptionally happy couple. He insinuates himself into their lives, becomes obsessed with their relationship and attempts to seduce the wife, thereby causing destruction. One of the most elegant of Chabrol’s early works, the films presents an intriguing situation that develops with Hitchcockian undertones, even though the warped behaviour of the journalist remains somewhat of a puzzle. However Chabrol’s Peeping Tom camera is effectively used to suggest a study in voyeurism. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producers, Georges de Beauregard, Carlo Ponti ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writer, Claude Chabrol, Marcel Matthieu ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen.
Cast: Stephane Audran, Jacques Charrier, Walter Reyer, Daniel Boulanger, Andre Badin.

results.title: L'ironie du Sort = Irony of Chance
results.brief_description:
Set in Nantes, during the German Occupation, the film examines a series of events and shows what might have happened if one thing had gone differently in each instance. The main protagonists are two friends, Antoine and Jean, both in love with Marie-Anne, and both actively involved with the Resistance.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Edouard Molinaro ; writers, Edouard Molinaro, Paul Guimard, Pierre Kast ; photography, Alain Levent ; music, Jose Berghams.
Cast: Claude Rich, Pierre Clementi, Marie-Helene Breillat, Jacques Spiesser, Jean Desailly
